description: Get real-time search engine optimization data by location.

blocks.name: login
blocks.description: Create a new session key for the user. (Execute this first)

args.name: apiKey
args.info: User apiKey obtained from georanker.com

args.name: email
args.info: User email adress

blocks.name: getMe
blocks.description: Read the user information

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

blocks.name: getMySettings
blocks.description: Read the user settings

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

blocks.name: updateMySettings
blocks.description: Update the user settings

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: countryCode
args.info: Country code (example: DE = Germany)

args.name: isMergeNotifications
args.info: Send or not all email notifications merged in your specified time.

args.name: isSendNews
args.info: Inform or not about new features/updates

args.name: notificationsTime
args.info: Notification time

args.name: timezone
args.info: Set your timezone (notificationTime based on this parametr)

args.name: wlHeading
args.info: Title (This field using on the Whitelabel settings for PDF reports generated on GeoRanker GUI)

args.name: wlSubheading
args.info: Subtitle (This field using on the Whitelabel settings for PDF reports generated on GeoRanker GUI)

args.name: wlUserLogo
args.info: Logo url (This field using on the Whitelabel settings for PDF reports generated on GeoRanker GUI)

blocks.name: getApiChangeLog
blocks.description: Read the API ChageLog

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

blocks.name: getGeoRankerBlogNews
blocks.description: Read the News from GeoRanker Blog

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

blocks.name: getCountryDataByCode
blocks.description: Read the complete data of a country by code

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: code
args.info: Country code USA=us, Germany=de

blocks.name: getCountries
blocks.description: Read the full list of countries

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

blocks.name: getLanguageDataByCode
blocks.description: Read the complete data of a language by code

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: languageCode
args.info: Language code (example en=English)

blocks.name: getLanguages
blocks.description: Read the full list of languages

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

blocks.name: getReports
blocks.description: Read the list of Reports

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: pageNum
args.info: The page number. Default: 1

args.name: itemsPerPage
args.info: The max number of reports that each page will contain. Default: 30

blocks.name: getSingleReport
blocks.description: Read the complete data of a report

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: report
args.info: The report id or token. Example: '150' or '123se2'

blocks.name: createReport
blocks.description: Creates a new report

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: searchEngines
args.info: List of Search Engines (google, googlelocal, yahoo, bing, yandex, youtube, naverwebdocs, naverlocal, baidu,googlenews, googleimages). Default: google

args.name: callback
args.info: Link to callback

args.name: countries
args.info: Comma-Separated list of Country codes

args.name: ignoreTypes
args.info: This is an array with 2 letter strings that allow you to make crawler completely ignore a search result type. The options are 'OR' (organic), 'GM' (google maps)

args.name: isFillCities
args.info: If your report has fewer cities than the maxcities, crawler will automatically fill the report cities with the biggest cities from the country.

args.name: isForMobile
args.info: Is this report for mobile platform

args.name: isGlobal
args.info: True if the report is a country-level report.

args.name: monitorId
args.info: Monitor Id

args.name: isUseAlternativeTld
args.info: If true, it will always use the TLD.com instead of using the local TLDs for each country.

args.name: keywords
args.info: Comma-Separated list of keywords. You must specify at least one keyword. The keyword must contain at least 3 characters.

args.name: language
args.info: Language

args.name: maxCities
args.info: Max City count

args.name: regions
args.info: Comma-Separated list of regions. Example [Asia]

args.name: totalResults
args.info: The maximum amount of results we will crawl. Usually, you want to keep this at 100.

args.name: type
args.info: ranktracker, heatmap, 1stpage, advertisers, authors, citations, sitereport and keywordrankings

args.name: url
args.info: Url. Required with ranktracker type.

blocks.name: deleteSingleReport
blocks.description: Delete the report

args.name: email
args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: report
args.info: Report id or token. Exmaple '150' or '123ads4'

args.info: The max number of monitors that each page will contain. Default: 30

args.info: User email

args.name: session
args.info: User session obtained from login method

args.name: reportId
args.info: The report id. Example: '105'

args.name: monitorType
args.info: Type of Monitor: ranktracker, heatmap, firstpage, advertisers, authors, citations, keywordrankings

args.name: isSendEmail
args.info: Email alerts on significant changes

args.name: periodicity
args.info: d - Daily, w - Weekly, f - Fortnightly, m - Monthly
